# requestImageCapture()

**Instance Method**

Requests a manual image capture.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func requestImageCapture()
```

## Discussion

If the session’s state is `.capturing`, call this method to request an image be manually captured at the current location. This function has no effect if the session is in any other state, or if [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession/canRequestImageCapture] is `false`.

## Controlling the session

- **cancel()**: Requests that the capture session be canceled.
- **finish()**: Requests that the capture session be stopped and all data saved.
- **pause()**: Pauses the automatic capture and other resource-intense algorithms.
- **resume()**: Resumes object tracking algorithms after [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ObjectCaptureSession/pause()] is called.
- **startCapturing()**: Begins taking images for object capture.
